## GAD-7 vs CII

In  psychology and social science research, the comparison between mental health assessment tools, such as GAD-7 and CII, is often necessary but challenging. This is especially so given the manual work required for the harmonisation process, which can be time-consuming and subjective. However, the Harmony software can dramatically ease this process. For instance, it can help researchers compare GAD-7 vs CII, automating the analysis and saving time. Harmony uses state-of-the-art natural language processing and generative AI models to compare and harmonise questionnaire items such as GAD-7 vs CII. This tool compares each item in both GAD-7, a measure for generalised anxiety disorder, and CII, the Coder Impression Inventory, to provide a percentage match between them. This critical feature enables researchers to make accurate comparisons both within and across different studies. The usability and accessibility of Harmony are also critical aspects worth noting. Not only does the software come with a database of instruments, but users can also drag and drop their own instruments in PDF format into Harmony's web interface for analysis. Harmony can even compare items in multiple languages, making it a versatile tool for international research collaboration. We recommend using Harmony for comparisons such as GAD-7 vs CII, stimulating productivity and accuracy in psychology research.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and CII

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and CII into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just CII into Harmony</a> - compare CII with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
